text: Verbs that use Real Conditional in daily life RC = Real Conditional , WC = würde-conditional haben sein können müssen ich hätt-e wär-e könnte müsste du hätt-est wär-st könntest müsstest er/sie/es hätt-e wär-e könnte ... wir/sie hätt-en wär-en könnten ... ihr hätt-et wär-t könntet ... real conditional is idiomatic for those two Strictly RC except when for expressing wishes for ability with „gern“. Then you need WC. Just go with RC. wollen wollt-e Choice between RC and WC depends on the phrasing. WC is slightly more common. dürfen dürft-e Mostly RC. „drüfte“ is also used for „should“ in context of making assumptions. mögen möcht-e RC has become a verb of its own, that expresses wanting. If you need actual potential liking you need to use WC sollen sollt-e Strictly RC.WC sounds wrong. kommen käm-e WC for literal sense, RC for figurative – especially for ''ankommen auf'' and ''vorkommen'' gehen ging-e RC common especially for the sense of ''functioning/working“ geben gäb-e RC especially common for the sense of „there would be“: ... „es gäbe“ sehen säh-e RC especially common for ''aussehen“ finden fänd-e RC especially common in sense of expressing opinions: ''ich fände es gut...“ nehmen nähm-e WC is a safe choice, but you might hear RC as well liegen läg-e Again, go with WC and don't get confused if you hear RC yourdailygerman.com © 2018
